examples: it was his unshakeable resolution to finish the work

results.definition: a formal expression by a meeting; agreed to by a vote
a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem
finding a solution to a problem
the ability of a microscope or telescope to measure the angular separation of images that are close together
something settled or resolved; the outcome of decision making
examples: they never did achieve a final resolution of their differences

results.definition: a decision to do something or to behave in a certain manner
examples: he always wrote down his New Year's resolutions

results.definition: (computer science) the number of pixels per square inch on a computer-generated display; the greater the resolution, the better the picture
(music) a dissonant chord is followed by a consonant chord
the subsidence of swelling or other signs of inflammation (especially in a lung)
